title: Drawing, "A Domestic Dispute in Tivoli", 1807–08
medium:
pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk
off-white wove paper
signed: pen and black ink at lower right: Pinelli / fece 1807; in pen and brown ink on verso: Pinelli fece 1808 / abita No. 90 vicinio il Caffe / Piazza di / Spagna
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Vignette of four figures struggling with a dagger, one of which is a woman with a baby slung across her chest. Another woman rushes into the scene from a doorway behind them set in a rustic building.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "A Domestic Dispute in Tivoli", 1807–08.
1807–08. pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk
off-white wove paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-73-291.
